intro: Hieracium crassum, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, featuring basal leaves that are broad and sometimes lobed. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head, surrounded by a series of bracts. Hieracium crassum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
